channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syria’s Interim President Calls for Unity Amid Fresh Fighting
item.description: More than 1,000 people have been killed in clashes in the coastal provinces of Syria, according to one war monitoring group.

item.title: There Is a Liberal Answer to Elon Musk
item.description: Right-wing populism thrives on scarcity. The answer is abundance. But a politics of abundance will work only if Democrats confront where their approac...

item.title: New York governor declares state of emergency for wind-driven brush fire on Long Island
item.description: She said homes, a chemical factory and an Amazon warehouse were at risk and more evacuations may be needed.

item.title: Violence Sweeps Coastal Syria, Sowing Chaos: ‘We Have to Get Out of Here’
item.description: Residents described shootings outside their homes and bodies in the streets in Syria’s worst unrest since Bashar al-Assad’s ouster. More than 1,000 pe...

item.title: Plan to Return Russian Diplomats to U.S. Poses Espionage Risk
item.description: The Trump administration is negotiating the return of more Russian diplomats to the United States. Some are likely to be spies.

item.title: Musk calls on US to quit NATO, stop paying for defense of Europe
item.description: Trump said he told NATO allies that if they’re not going to pay their bills, he won’t defend them.

item.title: How Would Peacekeeping Work in Ukraine? These Experts Gamed It Out.
item.description: The publication of the detailed analysis was a sign that a cease-fire has gone from a theoretical exercise to an urgent and practical issue.

item.title: Secret Service shoots armed man near the White House after getting report of ‘suicidal individual’
item.description: President Donald Trump was in Florida at the time of the shooting.

item.title: Canada’s Liberal Party To Elect New Leader and Prime Minister to Replace Trudeau: What to Know
item.description: Front-runner Mark Carney and underdog Chrystia Freeland, both established, centrist policymakers, are vying to succeed Justin Trudeau amid grave threa...

item.title: Technofascism Is Here. We Have One Way Out
item.description: Big Tech has taken control of our democracy. The answer is to build decentralized platforms these companies can't control.

item.title: What I Found on the 365-Mile Trail of a Lost Folk Hero
item.description: The Old Leatherman, a sort of real-life Northeastern Sasquatch, g​ave me an excuse to step outside my own life.

item.title: HHS workers who research diseases, inspect food and administer Medicare and Medicaid are offered $25,000 buyouts
item.description: The workers have until 5 p.m. on Friday to submit a response for the so-called voluntary separation offer.

item.description: More than 1,000 people have been killed in clashes in the coastal provinces of Syria, according to one war monitoring group.
